description: On September 13, 2011, Chelsea kicked off their 2011/12 Champions League campaign with a solid 2-0 win over Bayer Leverkusen at Stamford Bridge. Goals from David Luiz in the 67th minute and Juan Mata in stoppage time marked the beginning of their journey to European glory.

On September 28, 2011, Chelsea were denied all three points at the Mestalla after a late penalty by Roberto Soldado secured a 1-1 draw for Valencia. Frank Lampard had given the visitors the lead earlier in the second half.
On October 19, 2011, Chelsea dominated Genk with a 5-0 victory at Stamford Bridge. Goals from Raul Meireles, a brace by Fernando Torres, Branislav Ivanović, and Salomon Kalou secured the win.
On November 1, 2011, Chelsea were held to a 1-1 draw by Genk at the Cristal Arena. Ramires opened the scoring, but Jelle Vossen equalized for the hosts in the second half.

On November 23, 2011, Chelsea suffered a 2-1 defeat to Bayer Leverkusen at the BayArena. Didier Drogba gave Chelsea the lead, but goals from Eren Derdiyok and Manuel Friedrich turned the game around for the germans.

On December 6, 2011, Chelsea secured a 3-0 win over Valencia at Stamford Bridge, ensuring progression to the knockout stages. Didier Drogba scored twice, and Ramires added another to seal the victory.

On February 21, 2012, Chelsea faced a 3-1 defeat against Napoli at the Stadio San Paolo. Goals from Ezequiel Lavezzi and Edinson Cavani gave the hosts a strong advantage, despite Juan Mata's opener for Chelsea.

On March 14, 2012, Chelsea completed a remarkable comeback at Stamford Bridge, defeating Napoli 4-1 after extra time. Goals from Didier Drogba, John Terry, Frank Lampard, and Branislav Ivanović overturned the first-leg deficit, advancing Chelsea to the quarter-finals.
On March 27, 2012, Chelsea secured a 1-0 away victory against Benfica at the Estádio da Luz. Salomon Kalou's second-half goal gave the Blues a crucial advantage heading into the second leg.
On April 4, 2012, Chelsea advanced to the semi-finals with a 2-1 win over Benfica at Stamford Bridge. Goals from Frank Lampard and Raul Meireles ensured progression with a 3-1 aggregate score.

On April 18, 2012, Chelsea took a 1-0 lead in the semi-final first leg against Barcelona at Stamford Bridge. Didier Drogba's goal just before halftime made the difference in a tightly contested match.

On April 24, 2012, Chelsea held Barcelona to a 2-2 draw at the Camp Nou, securing their place in the final with a 3-2 aggregate win. Goals from Ramires and Fernando Torres were crucial in overcoming the defending champions.

On May 19, 2012, Chelsea clinched their first Champions League title by defeating Bayern Munich in a dramatic final at the Allianz Arena. After a 1-1 draw in regular and extra time, the Blues triumphed 4-3 in the penalty shootout. Didier Drogba scored the equalizer and the winning penalty.
